edu.first.module.subsystems

Class Subsystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.first.module.subsystems.Subsystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Module

    public class Subsystem
extends java.lang.Object
implements Module
    Groups of modules that perform more useful functions than actuators and sensors. A subsystem should perform some kind of action(s) that would be impossible for the individual modules themselves to do. Subsystems are things like "arms", "shooters" and "compressors". They are elements of the robot with multiple components which act together.

    All components in a subsystem should be passed into the constructor (Subsystem(edu.first.module.Module[])). There should be no modules that are not put into that array.

    All modules that are passed in the constructor are called in the order of the array in init(), enable(), disable() and isEnabled(). The subsystem does all of the work to keep its members in the same state that it is.

    If the programmer wants the subsystem to perform any special function specific to the subsystem in init(), enable(), disable() and/or isEnabled(), they can use initSubsystem(), enableSubsystem(), disableSubsystem() and/or isSubsystemEnabled() respectively to do those functions. Just override them and they will be called in the Module methods.

    Since:
    May 22 13

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void disable()
      Calls Module.disable() on every module in the subsystem.
      void disableSubsystem()
      Placeholder method that is called before the internal modules are disabled.

      Calls Module.enable() on every module in the subsystem.
      void enableSubsystem()
      Placeholder method that is called after the internal modules are enabled.
      void init()
      Calls Module.init() on every module in the subsystem.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Subsystem

        public Subsystem(Module[] modules)
        Constructs the subsystem by passing an array with all of the modules used in the subsystem. These modules are initialized, enabled and disabled along with this subsystem.
        Parameters:
        modules - array of all the modules to be initialized, enabled and disabled with this subsystem

    • Method Detail

      • initSubsystem

        public void initSubsystem()
        Placeholder method that is called after the internal modules are initialized. This should ensure the module is "ready" to work.

        Override this method to use it. No super call is necessary.

      • enableSubsystem

        public void enableSubsystem()
        Placeholder method that is called after the internal modules are enabled. This should ensure the module's functions are "ready" to work.

        Override this method to use it. No super call is necessary.

      • disableSubsystem

        public void disableSubsystem()
        Placeholder method that is called before the internal modules are disabled. This should ensure the module's functions are no longer "ready" to work.

        Override this method to use it. No super call is necessary.

      • isSubsystemEnabled

        public boolean isSubsystemEnabled()
        Placeholder method that is called along with isEnabled(). This should return whether the module's functions are "ready" to work.

        Override this method to use it. No super call is necessary.

      • init

        public final void init()
        Calls Module.init() on every module in the subsystem.

        Calls initSubsystem() after it initializes the modules.

        Specified by:
        init in interface Module

      • enable

        public final void enable()
        Calls Module.enable() on every module in the subsystem.

        Calls enableSubsystem() after it enables the modules.

        Specified by:
        enable in interface Module

      • disable

        public final void disable()
        Calls Module.disable() on every module in the subsystem.

        Calls disableSubsystem() before it disables the modules.

        Specified by:
        disable in interface Module

      • isEnabled

        public final boolean isEnabled()
        Returns whether every module is enabled, and that the subsystem is enabled.
        Specified by:
        isEnabled in interface Module
        Returns:
        if everything is enabled
